channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: IBM’s CEO disagrees with JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon’s disdain for texting in meetings: ‘Telling people they can’t use their technology would be weird’
item.description: Jamie Dimon calls checking your email during a meeting disrespectful—but IBM’s CEO says he doesn’t care, depending on the number of people in the room...

item.title: Wall Street sinks under the weight of its own expectations as Big Tech’s AI high fades and Fed doubts creep in
item.description: AI darlings Palantir, Nvidia, and Tesla slide, sinking the S&P and the Dow in the early going Tuesday.

item.title: Dictionary.com risks Gen Z mockery by crowning ‘6-7’ as word of the year
item.description: “Don’t worry, because we’re all still trying to figure out exactly what it means," the site said in its unusual announcement that lacked a definition.

item.title: What Block’s CFO and finance team want peers to know about Bitcoin
item.description: Block, Inc. made its first corporate bitcoin purchase in 2020.

item.title: New York’s mayoral race becomes a national test of economic populism as Mamdani challenges Cuomo’s comeback
item.description: New York City's voters are deciding the outcome of a generational and ideological divide that will resonate across the country.

item.title: Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq open lower as technology stocks struggle
Affordability is on the ballot as voters head to the polls
Norway's sovereign wealth fund to vote 'no' on Elon Musk pay plan
Uber’s upbeat earnings may not be enough to carry the stock to fresh highs
Follow the shutdown's damage to the economy as it nears longest ever
